scope: Texas songwriter and acoustic music venues with regular series or significant historical relevance

venues.name: Bell Springs Winery & Brewery Live Music

instances.address: 3700 Bell Springs Rd, Dripping Springs, TX 78620
instances.description: Winery and brewery with relaxed atmosphere, live music on weekends, and scenic Hill Country grounds. Full food menu available on weekends.
instances.cost_notes: No cover; wine/beer tastings and food available for purchase.

venues.name: Ghost Note Brewing Live Music Series

instances.description: Hill Country brewery with free live music on outdoor stage under the oaks most Fridays through Sundays. Family and pet-friendly beer garden with food trucks.
instances.cost_notes: Free admission; donations accepted at door. Check schedule as shows are weather-permitting.

instances.description: Historic dance hall in Dripping Springs featuring live music and special events. Traditional Texas dancehall atmosphere in the heart of Hill Country.

instances.address: 501 Old Fitzhugh Rd, Dripping Springs, TX 78620
instances.description: Prohibition-era themed wine and beer tasting room in downtown Dripping Springs, featuring weekly live music and entertainment in cozy indoor and outdoor patio spaces.
instances.cost_notes: No cover; wine and beer available for purchase.

instances.description: Texas Hill Country saloon and steakhouse with dance floor and live music on weekends. Full bar and restaurant with regular dancing.
Family-owned boutique winery with cozy acoustic sessions on Thursdays and Saturdays. Features country and acoustic artists in an intimate, 38-acre estate setting with Italian-inspired tasting room.
instances.cost_notes: No cover; wine tastings and food pairings available.

instances.description: Wine bar, bistro, and live music venue open Thu/Fri/Sat evenings. Features bluesy, jazzy, Americana, and singer-songwriter performances with large covered outdoor seating, fire pit, and weekly specials.
instances.cost_notes: No cover; bistro menu $14-$35. Live music 7pm-10pm.

instances.description: Legendary dance hall and caf√© opened in 1942, historic venue for country and Americana. Has hosted Willie Nelson, Patsy Cline, Bob Dylan, and countless Texas artists.
Open-air venue in historic Gruene with spacious patio and craft cocktails. Regular local and regional artists. Thursday nights feature The Speakeasy, an intimate songwriter showcase.
instances.cost_notes: Free; food and drinks available for purchase.

instances.description: Texas' oldest continually operating dance hall, built in 1878. Legendary venue that's hosted George Strait, Willie Nelson, Lyle Lovett, and countless Texas music icons. Daily live music in historic open-air setting.
instances.cost_notes: Mix of free shows and ticketed concerts; check calendar.

instances.address: 295 W San Antonio St, New Braunfels, TX 78130
instances.description: Downtown courtyard bar with live music every night. Relaxed atmosphere, daily drink specials, and diverse lineup of local performers.
instances.cost_notes: Free; full bar with daily specials.

instances.address: 1260 Elliot Knox Blvd, New Braunfels, TX 78130
instances.description: Intimate listening room dedicated to singer-songwriters. Thursday Songwriter Nights showcase original music in attentive, no-frills setting. Connection between artist and audience is the focus.
North Central music venue featuring touring singer-songwriters on weekends, with open mic on Sundays. Craft beer selection and quality sound system.
instances.cost_notes: Cover varies by show; Sunday open mic free.

instances.address: 330 E. Grayson St, San Antonio, TX 78215
instances.description: Premier San Antonio listening room near the Pearl, featuring touring singer-songwriters and local talent. Weekly Live and Local series showcases emerging artists.

instances.address: 606 W. Cypress St, San Antonio, TX 78212
instances.description: Casual spot with live music five nights a week, ranging from singer-songwriter performances to garage rock, jazz, and monthly blues jam. Food-focused venue with outdoor seating.

instances.address: 212 N LBJ Dr, San Marcos, TX 78666
instances.description: Arts hub coffee shop with outdoor patio. Features Bluegrass Wednesdays and Singer-Songwriter Sundays. Coffee art, whole-leaf teas, and creative community atmosphere.
instances.cost_notes: Free; coffee and food available for purchase.
